Get the Alexander Rutherford Scholarship  provided to encourage senior high school students to pursue higher education by recognizing and rewarding their academic success. details of the scholarships is given below;

Rutherford Scholarship Summary:

  • Study Level: Undergraduate
  • University: University of Alberta
  • Award Amount: Up to $2500
  • The Award will be given in: Canada
  • Application Deadline: July-31-2024

Eligibility

Once you have your official high school transcript and are enrolled full-time in a college or university, you can apply. There will be varying requirements for high school transcript marks.

You must also fulfill all of the following eligibility requirements to be eligible for this Rutherford scholarship:

  • Be a citizen of Canada, a permanent resident of Canada, or a person who is protected by the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act of Canada (visa students are not eligible)
  • Be a resident of Alberta, and in order to be considered a resident of Alberta, the following requirements must be met:
      • Prior to the applicant beginning a program of study, one parent or legal guardian must have maintained permanent residence in Canada for at least 12 consecutive months;
      • Applicant has been a permanent resident of Alberta for at least a year prior to beginning a study program;
      • A scholarship cannot be awarded to an applicant for any grade unless the applicant or their parent(s) or legal guardian lived in Alberta for the entirety of that grade.
  • Have graduated from high school by September 30, 1980 or later.
  • Be enrolled full-time in a minimum of one semester of a designated undergraduate postsecondary or apprenticeship program.

Selection

A student must earn a minimum cumulative grade point average in at least one of their five designated courses. 10, 11, or 12 as determined by:

  • Residents of Alberta: Courses and marks on an official Alberta High School
  • Achievement Transcript Completed High School Outside of Alberta Courses and marks on an official transcript from another province

When students apply for the Alexander Rutherford Scholarship, they will automatically be considered for the following awards. These awards do not require a separate application.

  • Rutherford Scholars Award
  • Dr. Ernest and Minnie Mehl Scholarship
  • Mildred Rowe Weston Memorial Scholarships

How Can I Apply?

Start Application when:

  • You will attend full-time post-secondary studies between August 1, 2024 and July 31, 2024
  • Your official high school transcripts are available.
  • You have completed any high school upgrading credit courses you are taking – because you can only apply once, and you will want to submit your highest marks.
    Note: Your high school upgrading credit courses must appear on an official Alberta High School Transcript of Achievement.

AND

  • You have completed high school on or after September 30, 1980.

Login to Application

Login to your Alberta Student Aid account and choose the Alexander Rutherford High School Achievement Scholarship in the Apply section.

Document Information required for Rutherford Scholarship

  • Social Insurance Number (SIN)
    Your SIN will be validated with the Government of Canada before your application is reviewed
  • Alberta Student Number (ASN)
    • Your ASN can be found on your Alberta Transcript of High School Achievement
    • If you do not have an ASN, you can request one:
      • Request/Lookup ASN

School Information

  • Post-secondary school you are going to attend
  • Start date
  • High school you attended
